databricks:position-deletes:v2.notes: Iceberg v2 position deletes are explicitly not supported. Databricks uses v3 deletion vectors for row-level deletions instead.
caveats: Iceberg v2 position deletes are explicitly unsupported

databricks:position-deletes:v3.notes: Position deletes are a v2 concept. Iceberg v3 replaces them with deletion vectors, which Databricks fully supports.
caveats: V3 uses deletion vectors, not position deletes

databricks:equality-deletes:v2.notes: Iceberg v2 equality-based deletes are explicitly not supported. Databricks uses v3 deletion vectors instead.
caveats: Iceberg v2 equality deletes are explicitly unsupported

databricks:equality-deletes:v3.notes: Equality deletes are a v2 concept replaced by deletion vectors in v3, which Databricks fully supports.
caveats: V3 uses deletion vectors, not equality deletes

databricks:merge-on-read:v2.notes: Merge-on-read is not supported. Databricks does not support v2 position or equality deletes which are required for merge-on-read.
caveats: No v2 delete file support means no merge-on-read

databricks:merge-on-read:v3.notes: Iceberg v3 deletion vectors enable efficient row-level deletes without rewriting data files, functionally equivalent to merge-on-read. Enabled by default on v3 tables. Requires DBR 17.3+ (Beta).
caveats: Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)
Uses Iceberg v3 deletion vectors, not v2-style merge-on-read

databricks:copy-on-write:v2.notes: Copy-on-write is the default write mode for managed Iceberg tables in Databricks. Managed Iceberg tables are in Public Preview (DBR 16.4 LTS+).
caveats: Managed Iceberg tables are in Public Preview (requires DBR 16.4 LTS+)

databricks:copy-on-write:v3.notes: Copy-on-write supported for Iceberg v3 tables. Requires DBR 17.3+ (Beta).
caveats: Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)

databricks:schema-evolution:v2.notes: Full schema evolution supported on managed Iceberg tables including add, rename, drop, and reorder columns. Managed Iceberg tables are in Public Preview (DBR 16.4 LTS+).
caveats: Managed Iceberg tables are in Public Preview (requires DBR 16.4 LTS+)

databricks:schema-evolution:v3.notes: Full schema evolution supported on managed Iceberg v3 tables. Requires DBR 17.3+ (Beta).
caveats: Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)

databricks:column-default-values:v2.notes: Column default values are an Iceberg v3 feature not available in v2.

databricks:column-default-values:v3.notes: Column default values (write defaults and initial defaults) are explicitly not supported in Databricks Iceberg v3 implementation.
caveats: Explicitly listed as unsupported in Databricks Iceberg v3 limitations

databricks:nanosecond-timestamps:v2.notes: Nanosecond timestamps are an Iceberg v3 feature not available in v2.

databricks:nanosecond-timestamps:v3.notes: Nanosecond precision timestamps are explicitly not supported in Databricks Iceberg v3 implementation.
caveats: Explicitly listed as unsupported in Databricks Iceberg v3 limitations

databricks:hidden-partitioning:v2.notes: Hidden partitioning is supported on managed Iceberg tables, but partitioning by expressions (years, months, days, hours, bucket) is not supported. Partitioning by BINARY type is also unsupported.
caveats: Expression-based partitioning (years, months, days, hours, bucket) not supported on managed Iceberg tables
BINARY type partitioning not supported
Managed Iceberg tables are in Public Preview (requires DBR 16.4 LTS+)

databricks:hidden-partitioning:v3.notes: Hidden partitioning is supported on managed Iceberg v3 tables, but expression-based partitioning (years, months, days, hours, bucket) is not supported.
caveats: Expression-based partitioning (years, months, days, hours, bucket) not supported on managed Iceberg tables
BINARY type partitioning not supported
Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)

databricks:partition-evolution:v2.notes: Partition evolution is supported on managed Iceberg tables only when interacting from external Iceberg engines (e.g. Spark, Flink). Not available directly via Databricks SQL, and not supported on foreign Iceberg tables.
caveats: Only supported via external Iceberg engines, not directly in Databricks SQL
Not supported on foreign Iceberg tables
Managed Iceberg tables are in Public Preview (requires DBR 16.4 LTS+)

databricks:partition-evolution:v3.notes: Partition evolution is supported on managed Iceberg tables only when interacting from external Iceberg engines. Not available directly via Databricks SQL.
caveats: Only supported via external Iceberg engines, not directly in Databricks SQL
Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)

databricks:multi-arg-transforms:v2.notes: Multi-argument transforms are an Iceberg v3 feature not available in v2.

databricks:multi-arg-transforms:v3.notes: Multi-argument transforms are explicitly not supported in Databricks Iceberg v3 implementation.
caveats: Explicitly listed as unsupported in Databricks Iceberg v3 limitations

databricks:time-travel:v2.notes: Time travel fully supported for managed Iceberg tables. For foreign Iceberg tables, time travel is limited to snapshots previously read in Databricks.
caveats: Foreign Iceberg tables: time travel only for previously-read snapshots
Managed Iceberg tables are in Public Preview (requires DBR 16.4 LTS+)

databricks:time-travel:v3.notes: Time travel and RESTORE TABLE supported for managed Iceberg v3 tables. Requires DBR 17.3+ (Beta).
caveats: Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)

databricks:table-maintenance:v2.notes: Predictive optimization provides automatic compaction, snapshot expiration, and file compaction for managed Iceberg tables. Unity Catalog manages lifecycle tasks. Predictive optimization must be enabled.
caveats: Predictive optimization must be enabled for managed Iceberg table creation
Managed Iceberg tables are in Public Preview (requires DBR 16.4 LTS+)

databricks:table-maintenance:v3.notes: Predictive optimization provides automatic compaction, snapshot expiration, and file compaction for managed Iceberg v3 tables. Requires DBR 17.3+ (Beta).
caveats: Predictive optimization must be enabled for managed Iceberg table creation
Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)

databricks:branching-tagging:v2.notes: Branching and tagging are explicitly not supported for Iceberg tables in Databricks. Only the main branch is accessible.
caveats: Explicitly listed as unsupported in Databricks Iceberg documentation

databricks:branching-tagging:v3.notes: Branching and tagging are explicitly not supported for Iceberg tables in Databricks. Only the main branch is accessible.
caveats: Explicitly listed as unsupported in Databricks Iceberg documentation

databricks:read-support:v2.notes: Full read support for native managed Iceberg v2 tables via Unity Catalog (Public Preview, DBR 16.4 LTS+). Also supports read-only access to foreign Iceberg tables via Lakehouse Federation. Note: UniForm is a separate Delta Lake feature that exposes Delta tables as Iceberg — it is not native Iceberg.
caveats: Managed Iceberg tables are in Public Preview (requires DBR 16.4 LTS+)
Some data types not supported: UUID, Fixed(L), TIME, nested STRUCT with required fields
UniForm (Delta + Iceberg reads) is a different feature from native managed Iceberg tables

databricks:read-support:v3.notes: Full read support for native managed Iceberg v3 tables. Requires DBR 17.3+ (Beta). Some v3 data types are not yet supported.
caveats: Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)
Geospatial types, nanosecond timestamps, and multi-arg transforms not supported

databricks:write-insert:v2.notes: INSERT INTO fully supported for native managed Iceberg tables in Unity Catalog. External engines can also write via the Iceberg REST Catalog API. Note: UniForm tables are read-only for Iceberg clients.
caveats: Managed Iceberg tables are in Public Preview (requires DBR 16.4 LTS+)
UniForm (Delta + Iceberg reads) tables are read-only for Iceberg clients — this is not native Iceberg

databricks:write-insert:v3.notes: INSERT INTO fully supported for native managed Iceberg v3 tables. Requires DBR 17.3+ (Beta).
caveats: Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)

databricks:write-merge-update-delete:v2.notes: MERGE, UPDATE, DELETE fully supported for native managed Iceberg tables via copy-on-write. Managed Iceberg tables are in Public Preview (DBR 16.4 LTS+).
caveats: Managed Iceberg tables are in Public Preview (requires DBR 16.4 LTS+)
Uses copy-on-write for row-level operations in v2 (no v2 delete files)

databricks:write-merge-update-delete:v3.notes: MERGE, UPDATE, DELETE fully supported for native managed Iceberg v3 tables with deletion vectors for efficient row-level operations. Requires DBR 17.3+ (Beta).
caveats: Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)

databricks:catalog-integration:v2.notes: Unity Catalog provides native Iceberg REST Catalog API support for both read and write access from external engines (Spark, Flink, Trino, PyIceberg, etc.). Credential vending supported.

databricks:catalog-integration:v3.notes: Unity Catalog provides native Iceberg REST Catalog API support with v3 compatibility. Requires DBR 17.3+ (Beta).
caveats: Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)

databricks:hive-metastore:v2.notes: Can read Iceberg tables from external Hive Metastore and AWS Glue via Lakehouse Federation foreign catalogs. Read-only for external HMS. Foreign Iceberg tables have limited platform feature support.
caveats: External Hive Metastore and Glue federation is read-only
Foreign Iceberg tables have limited platform feature support

databricks:hive-metastore:v3.notes: Can read Iceberg tables from external Hive Metastore via Lakehouse Federation. Read-only for external HMS.
caveats: External Hive Metastore federation is read-only
Foreign Iceberg tables have limited platform feature support

databricks:aws-glue-catalog:v2.notes: Can read Iceberg tables from AWS Glue Catalog via Lakehouse Federation foreign catalogs. Read-only access.
caveats: AWS Glue federation is read-only
Foreign Iceberg tables have limited platform feature support

databricks:aws-glue-catalog:v3.notes: Can read Iceberg tables from AWS Glue Catalog via Lakehouse Federation. Read-only access.
caveats: AWS Glue federation is read-only
Foreign Iceberg tables have limited platform feature support

databricks:rest-catalog:v2.notes: Unity Catalog implements the Iceberg REST Catalog API specification. Supports read and write for managed Iceberg tables. Credential vending supported for external engine access.

databricks:rest-catalog:v3.notes: Unity Catalog implements the Iceberg REST Catalog API with v3 support. Requires DBR 17.3+ (Beta).
caveats: Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)

databricks:nessie:v2.notes: Databricks does not natively support Nessie catalog.

databricks:nessie:v3.notes: Databricks does not natively support Nessie catalog.

databricks:polaris:v2.notes: Databricks documentation does not mention Polaris catalog integration. Unity Catalog supports the Iceberg REST Catalog API, which could theoretically connect to Polaris, but this is not documented.
caveats: Not documented in Databricks Iceberg documentation

databricks:polaris:v3.notes: Databricks documentation does not mention Polaris catalog integration for Iceberg v3 tables.
caveats: Not documented in Databricks Iceberg documentation

databricks:unity-catalog:v2.notes: Native Unity Catalog with Iceberg REST Catalog API support. Manages lifecycle tasks including snapshot expiration and file compaction. Supports credential vending for external engine access. Managed Iceberg tables are in Public Preview (DBR 16.4 LTS+).
caveats: Managed Iceberg tables are in Public Preview (requires DBR 16.4 LTS+)

databricks:unity-catalog:v3.notes: Native Unity Catalog with Iceberg REST Catalog API support for v3 tables including deletion vectors and VARIANT type. Requires DBR 17.3+ (Beta).
caveats: Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)

databricks:hadoop-catalog:v2.notes: Databricks does not support Hadoop catalog for Iceberg.

databricks:hadoop-catalog:v3.notes: Databricks does not support Hadoop catalog for Iceberg.

databricks:jdbc-catalog:v2.notes: Databricks does not support JDBC catalog for Iceberg.

databricks:jdbc-catalog:v3.notes: Databricks does not support JDBC catalog for Iceberg.

databricks:table-creation:v2.notes: Supports CREATE TABLE ... USING iceberg for native managed Iceberg tables in Unity Catalog. External engines can also create tables via the REST Catalog API. Note: UniForm (TBLPROPERTIES delta.universalFormat.enabledFormats = 'iceberg') creates Delta tables with Iceberg reads — not native Iceberg.
caveats: Managed Iceberg tables are in Public Preview (requires DBR 16.4 LTS+)
Predictive optimization must be enabled for managed Iceberg table creation
UniForm creates Delta tables with Iceberg compatibility layer, not native Iceberg tables

databricks:table-creation:v3.notes: Supports creating native Iceberg v3 tables with deletion vectors and VARIANT columns. Existing v2 tables can be upgraded to v3 (irreversible). Requires DBR 17.3+ (Beta).
caveats: Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)
Managed Iceberg tables upgraded to v3 cannot be downgraded

databricks:variant-type:v2.notes: VARIANT type requires Iceberg v3. Not available in v2 tables.

databricks:variant-type:v3.notes: VARIANT data type is fully supported on native Iceberg v3 tables. Adding a VARIANT column to an existing v2 table automatically upgrades it to v3. Requires DBR 15.3+ for read/write.
caveats: Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)
Adding a VARIANT column automatically upgrades an existing table to v3 (irreversible)

databricks:shredded-variant:v2.notes: Shredded Variant is a v3 feature not available in v2.

databricks:shredded-variant:v3.notes: VARIANT type is supported on Iceberg v3 tables but shredded variant (storing frequently accessed fields as separate columns) is not explicitly documented for managed Iceberg tables.
caveats: Not explicitly documented for managed Iceberg v3 tables

databricks:geometry-type:v2.notes: Geometry/geospatial types are an Iceberg v3 feature not available in v2.

databricks:geometry-type:v3.notes: Geospatial types are explicitly not supported in Databricks Iceberg v3 implementation.
caveats: Explicitly listed as unsupported in Databricks Iceberg v3 limitations

databricks:vector-type:v2.notes: Vector type is a v3 feature not available in v2.

databricks:vector-type:v3.notes: Vector type support for Iceberg v3 tables is not documented in Databricks. Vector search is explicitly not supported on managed Iceberg tables.
caveats: Vector search is not supported on managed Iceberg tables

databricks:cdc-support:v2.notes: Change Data Feed (CDF) is not supported on Iceberg tables in Databricks. CDF is a Delta Lake-only feature. Incremental processing (materialized views, streaming tables) is not supported when reading managed Iceberg tables as a source.
caveats: Iceberg does not support change data feed
Incremental processing not supported for managed Iceberg tables as source

databricks:cdc-support:v3.notes: Change Data Feed is not supported on Iceberg tables. Iceberg v3 row lineage provides CDC building blocks (row IDs, last-modified sequence numbers) but Databricks does not expose a CDC stream from Iceberg tables.
caveats: Row lineage provides CDC building blocks but change data feed is not supported on Iceberg tables
Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)
Materialized views and streaming tables cannot use Iceberg as incremental source

databricks:lineage:v2.notes: Row lineage (row IDs and last-modified sequence numbers) is an Iceberg v3-only feature. Not available in v2.

databricks:lineage:v3.notes: Row lineage is required and automatically enabled on all native Iceberg v3 tables. Tracks incremental changes with unique row IDs and last-modified sequence numbers. Requires DBR 17.3+ (Beta).
caveats: Row lineage is required for all v3 tables — cannot be disabled
Iceberg v3 features are in Beta (requires DBR 17.3+)

databricks:statistics:v2.notes: Column-level statistics support for managed Iceberg tables is not explicitly documented. Predictive optimization handles table maintenance but statistics details are not confirmed.
caveats: Not explicitly documented for managed Iceberg tables

databricks:statistics:v3.notes: Column-level statistics support for managed Iceberg v3 tables is not explicitly documented.
caveats: Not explicitly documented for managed Iceberg v3 tables

databricks:bloom-filters:v2.notes: Bloom filters are not supported for managed Iceberg tables. Delta Lake bloom filter indexes are a Delta-only feature and do not apply to native Iceberg tables.
caveats: Delta Lake bloom filter indexes are not available for Iceberg tables

databricks:bloom-filters:v3.notes: Bloom filters are not supported for managed Iceberg v3 tables. Delta-native bloom filter indexes do not apply to Iceberg format.
caveats: Bloom filter indexes not available for Iceberg tables

databricks:type-promotion:v2.notes: Type promotion/widening for managed Iceberg tables is not explicitly documented. Type widening is a documented Delta Lake feature but is not confirmed for native Iceberg tables.
caveats: Not explicitly documented for managed Iceberg tables

databricks:type-promotion:v3.notes: Type promotion/widening for managed Iceberg v3 tables is not explicitly documented. Type widening is a documented Delta Lake feature but is not confirmed for native Iceberg tables.
caveats: Not explicitly documented for managed Iceberg v3 tables
